Eggnog French Toast

Jump to Recipe

Indulge in the festive flavors of the holiday season with this delightful Eggnog French Toast recipe. Perfect for cozy winter mornings or holiday brunches, this dish combines the creamy richness of eggnog with the comforting familiarity of French toast, making it an irresistible treat for all ages. With just a few simple ingredients, including thick-cut bread like brioche or challah, eggs, and a dash of nutmeg, you can whip up a batch of this delectable breakfast in no time. Whether you’re entertaining family or simply treating yourself, this Eggnog French Toast is sure to bring warmth and joy to your table. Don’t forget to top it off with a drizzle of maple syrup for the ultimate sweet finish!

Ingredients

eggnog

For a non-dairy version, substitute with almond milk or coconut milk mixed with a pinch of nutmeg and vanilla. If you want a richer flavor, use homemade eggnog or a store-bought version that's less sweet.

eggs

If you're looking for an egg substitute, consider using flax eggs (1 tablespoon ground flaxseed mixed with 2.5 tablespoons water for each egg) or silken tofu blended until smooth. These options will alter the flavor slightly, so adjust sweetness accordingly.

bread (thick-cut, like brioche or challah)

If you don't have brioche or challah, any thick-cut bread like Texas toast or a rustic sourdough can work. For gluten-free options, use gluten-free bread and ensure it's thick enough to soak up the eggnog mixture.

vanilla extract

For a more intense vanilla flavor, consider using vanilla bean paste instead of extract. You can also infuse the milk with vanilla pods for added depth.

ground nutmeg

Freshly grated nutmeg provides a more potent and aromatic flavor compared to pre-ground. If you don't have nutmeg, cinnamon can be used as a substitute, but it will change the flavor profile.

butter

For a healthier option, consider using coconut oil or ghee instead of butter. If you're looking for a vegan alternative, try using vegan butter or a neutral oil.

maple syrup

For a twist, use flavored syrups like pecan or vanilla syrup. If you're looking to reduce sugar, consider drizzling with honey or agave syrup instead.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Prepare the Eggnog Mixture

    In a mixing bowl, whisk together 1 cup of eggnog, 2 eggs, 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract, and 1/2 teaspoon of ground nutmeg until well combined. Make sure the mixture is smooth without any lumps.

  • Step 2: Heat the Skillet

    Heat a skillet over medium heat and add 1 tablespoon of butter. Allow the butter to melt completely and begin to bubble slightly. This indicates that your skillet is ready for cooking.

  • Step 3: Soak the Bread

    Dip each slice of thick-cut bread (like brioche or challah) into the eggnog mixture. Allow the bread to soak for about 10-15 seconds on each side, ensuring it is well-coated but not overly soggy.

  • Step 4: Cook the French Toast

    Place the soaked bread into the heated skillet. Cook for 3-4 minutes on each side or until golden brown. Adjust the heat as necessary to avoid burning.

  • Step 5: Repeat Cooking

    Add more butter to the skillet as needed for cooking the remaining slices. Repeat the soaking and cooking process until all slices are cooked.

  • Step 6: Serve and Enjoy

    Serve hot, drizzled with maple syrup. You can also sprinkle additional nutmeg or powdered sugar on top for extra flavor.

Frequently Asked Questions

How do I properly whisk eggs and other ingredients together?

Start by cracking the eggs into a mixing bowl. Use a whisk or fork to beat the eggs until the yolks and whites are fully combined. Then add the eggnog, vanilla extract, and nutmeg, and continue whisking until everything is well blended and smooth.

What type of bread should I use for French toast?

Thick-cut bread works best for French toast as it soaks up the egg mixture without falling apart. Brioche or challah are excellent choices, but you can also use Texas toast or any other sturdy bread.

How do I know when the skillet is hot enough?

A good test is to sprinkle a few drops of water onto the skillet. If they sizzle and evaporate quickly, the skillet is ready. Alternatively, you can add a small piece of butter; if it melts and starts to bubble, it's time to cook!

How long should I cook the French toast on each side?

Cook each slice of French toast for about 3-4 minutes on medium heat, or until the bottom is golden brown. Flip and repeat on the other side until it reaches the same color.

What should I do if my French toast is cooking too quickly?

If your French toast is browning too fast, lower the heat. Cooking on medium or medium-low heat ensures that the inside cooks through without burning the outside.

How can I make my French toast extra flavorful?

You can enhance the flavor by adding a pinch of cinnamon or a splash of orange zest to the egg mixture. Topping it with fresh fruit or whipped cream can also elevate the dish!

Is there a safe way to handle raw eggs?

Always wash your hands, utensils, and surfaces after handling raw eggs to prevent foodborne illness. Use clean equipment and avoid cross-contamination with other foods.

What’s the best way to serve French toast?

Serve your French toast hot, drizzled with maple syrup. You can also add toppings like powdered sugar, fresh berries, or even a dollop of whipped cream for extra indulgence.

Can I make this recipe ahead of time?

You can prepare the eggnog mixture in advance and store it in the refrigerator. Just soak and cook the bread slices when you're ready to serve for the best texture.

What should I do if I have leftovers?

Store any leftover French toast in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3 days. Reheat in a toaster or on a skillet to enjoy again!

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

For a dairy-free version, substitute the eggnog with almond milk or coconut milk mixed with a dash of vanilla and nutmeg. To make it gluten-free, use gluten-free bread. If you want to reduce sugar, consider using sugar-free syrup or a fruit compote as a topping. This dish can easily accommodate vegetarian diets.

Pairings

Pair your Eggnog French Toast with crispy bacon or sausage links for a savory contrast. A side of seasonal fruit like pomegranate seeds, sliced bananas, or a citrus salad will add freshness and color. For beverages, consider serving with spiced apple cider, a warm cup of chai tea, or a festive mimosa made with sparkling wine and cranberry juice.

Serving Suggestions

Serve the Eggnog French Toast on a warm plate to maintain its temperature. Consider dusting the top with powdered sugar for a touch of sweetness and visual appeal. Garnish with a sprinkle of additional ground nutmeg or cinnamon, and a few mint leaves for freshness. For a more indulgent experience, top with whipped cream or a scoop of vanilla ice cream, especially if serving for brunch or a holiday gathering.

Eggnog French Toast

25 min
$5
350 kcal
Difficulty: 20%
Servings: 2

Allergens:

DairyEggsGluten

Dietary Tags:

Vegetarian

Cuisine:

American

Course:

BreakfastBrunch

Tags:

BreakfastEasyFestive

Description

Deliciously spiced French toast infused with eggnog flavors, perfect for a festive breakfast!

Ingredients

  • eggnog: 1 cup
  • eggs: 2
  • bread (thick-cut, like brioche or challah): 4 slices
  • vanilla extract: 1 tsp
  • ground nutmeg: 1/2 tsp
  • butter: 2 tbsp
  • maple syrup: for serving

Date Created:

11/21/2024
